The API Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(9) APIs are Languages [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDYeU2T4v2o&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw] and Promises [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFu7CQKmBeQ&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw] (for Machines)

  • An API is a Language [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDYeU2T4v2o&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw]
    • Two applications can communicate (within or across organizational boundaries)
    • Other applications can start using it because the language is well-defined
  • An API is a Promise [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFu7CQKmBeQ&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw]
    • A promise to provide services for programmatic access
    • A promise to keep the language stable for as long as possible


The API Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

API Business Value

Outline (API Business Value)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. APIs: More Than Tech [2]

  5. Getting APIs to Work [3]
  6. Jeff Bezos' API Mandate [6]

API Business Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(14) API Value #1: Collaboration

  • Teams collaborate through APIs
    • Value is exposed through APIs for others to use
    • Value is consumed through APIs for loose coupling
  • Teams always produce building blocks for others to use


API Business Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(15) API Value #2: Innovation

  • Innovation needs collaboration and autonomy
    • Collaboration becomes easier with loosely coupled APIs
    • Upfront investments become smaller because APIs are readily available
  • The available solution space becomes bigger


API Business Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(16) API Value #3: Co-Creation

  • Collaborating with partners becomes a natural thing to do
  • Replace integration with reusable interconnection for better scale
  • Business side must embrace business models based on business platforms


Getting APIs to Work

Outline (Getting APIs to Work)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. APIs: More Than Tech [2]
  3. The API Effect [4]
  4. API Business Value [3]
  5. Getting APIs to Work [3]
  6. Jeff Bezos' API Mandate [6]
  7. Conclusions [2]
Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(18) Precondition #1: Open Platform

  • Building an open platform allows everybody to participate
  • Maintaining/evolving it is more effort than building it
  • Focus on creating value on the platform instead of building it


Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(19) Precondition #2: Valuable APIs

  • APIs only create value when they are used
  • Business-aligned APIs are needed to create API Business Value [API Business Value (1)]
  • Everybody (tech/business) must understand how APIs (can) create value


Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(20) Precondition #3: Ecosystem Spirit

  • Moving from building a product to contributing a building block
  • No product is perfect, every product can be improved, so let's make that easy
  • Switching from building systems to evolving ecosystems can be challenging

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs

(29) The API Journey

  • APIs are necessary for digital transformation
  • API value needs APIs and it needs valuable APIs
  • Getting started is both hard and easy a the same time
    • Using APIs will not in itself create the desired value
    • Doing the right thing with APIs requires focus and execution


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Fueling Collaboration and Innovation with APIs
